title: 2023_DAIE_ICA_1_FM: Part A
text:
# gives us ggplot2, dplyr, readr, tibble etc
if(!require("tidyverse"))
  install.packages("tidyverse")

Loading required package: tidyverse


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(tidyverse)

# interactive plots
if(!require("plotly"))
  #install.packages("plotly")
  install.packages("plotly", repos = "http://cran.rstudio.com/", dependencies=TRUE)

Loading required package: plotly

Attaching package: 'plotly'

The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2':

    last_plot

The following object is masked from 'package:stats':

    filter

The following object is masked from 'package:graphics':

    layout

library(plotly)

# support for color blind users - see scale_color_colorblind() below
if(!require("ggthemes"))
  install.packages("ggthemes")

Loading required package: ggthemes

library(ggthemes)

# allows paginated tables
if(!require("DT"))
  install.packages("DT")

Loading required package: DT

library(DT)

#data manipulation
if(!require("dplyr"))
  install.packages("dplyr")
library(dplyr)

#allows to connect to database
if(!require("DBI"))
  install.packages("DBI")

Loading required package: DBI

library(DBI)

if(!require("RSQLite"))
  install.packages("RSQLite")

Loading required package: RSQLite

library(RSQLite)

title: 2023_DAIE_ICA_1_FM: Part A
section: Total Budget for Projects in each Country
text:
Total Budget for Projects in each Country

budPerProj <- dbGetQuery(conn, "SELECT CustomerCountry, SUM(Budget), COUNT(CustomerCountry) FROM Projects JOIN Customers ON Projects.CustomerID=Customers.CustomerID GROUP BY CustomerCountry ORDER BY SUM(Budget) DESC")
knitr::kable(budPerProj)




CustomerCountry
SUM(Budget)
COUNT(CustomerCountry)

400000

1

1

150000

title: 2023_DAIE_ICA_1_FM: Part A
section: Average Development Time per Project by Assests Used
text:
Average Development Time per Project by Assests Used

avgTimePerProj <- dbGetQuery(conn, "SELECT * FROM Projects JOIN Assets ON Projects.ProjectID=Assets.ProjectID GROUP BY AssetName")
knitr::kable(avgTimePerProj)
